snippet: Gov. Jay Nixon has argued that lower taxes would hurt education and mental health services, and has found support in the face of an override vote.
abstract: Missouri's Gov Jay Nixon, Democrat facing override of his tax cut veto in Republican-held State Legislature, has supporters rallying to his side; has turned debate away from Republican argument that lower taxes bring jobs and recast tax cut as one that would hurt education and mental health services; more than 100 of state’s school boards have passed resolutions supporting Nixon's veto, and now proponents of tax cut are feeling pessimistic.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jay Nixon has argued that lower taxes would hurt education and mental health services, and has found support in the face of an override vote.

headline.main: In Missouri, Governor Turns Tax Cut Debate Against G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: In Missouri, Governor Turns Tax Cut Debate Against G.O.P.
